alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 3:06PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Sampson, southeastern Harnett and central Cumberland Counties through 400 PM EST... At 306 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Godwin to 9 miles east of Fort Bragg to Fayetteville. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Dunn, Godwin, Hope Mills, Eastover, Stedman, Wade, Falcon, Autryville and Linden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
